website_summaries.verdict: Few dogs enjoy a trim, but this easy-to-hold, safe, and precise nail trimmer helps this important job go by more quickly than you may expect.
pros: Available in smaller and larger sizes
Reliably provides a quick and clean cut
cons: If you buy the wrong size for your dog, you may not appreciate this nail trimmer

customer_reviews.title: Prefer medium size instead of large (for German Shepherd + 2 small/medium dogs)
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered the large size thinking the standard wouldn't work for our German Shepherd but they were too big and the guard didn't stay in place. Had a disastrous experience clipping a nail too short as well. So I exchanged for the standard size and it's way better. I recommend the standard size unless you have a giant dog with crazy thick nails. The standard size is perfect for our 80 pound GSD. Posted a picture of the two different sizes for reference as well.
customer_reviews.author: towen

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP KNOCK-OFF CRAP!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Knock-Off! NOT Safari! Really unhappy this vendor sent this piece of crap, since I have 2 purebred German Shepherd Dogs who need their nails trimmed. Now I have to go find a pair of nail trimmers TODAY and I have to send this cheap crap back when they aren't worth the postage in the first place. Here's what the package says,"Chong wu qian" "Let your pet more lovely!" What the heck does that even mean? "Spring steel teeth" What teeth? There aren't any teeth in this item! "Non scratch" WHAT??? Whoever decided to send this junk instead of the Safari brand I ordered should be fired.
customer_reviews.author: MelMoMoney

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard-to-cut big dog nails!
customer_reviews.text: As a fur mom with an 80 lb pitmix with thick and hard nails, other clippers wouldn't make more than a dent. These cut through like butter with a nice clean cut, no chipping or ragged parts. Also, I have weak hand strength and can use them just fine. I go over the sharp edges with a dremel after and both of us are as happy as can be. If you have a big dog with equally big and tough nails, I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Briana Auclair

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comment on the quality of the metal, but even though the blades look sharp, they are not as sharp as they need to be. Our GSD got split and chipping nails shortly after cutting them using these clippers. I will likely have to find a place to get them professionally sharpened so they slice the tip of the nail instead of half cutting/crushing the nail.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Was Expecting
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting clippers that say Safari that come in the package shown by several reviewers. However, I received the ones shown which seem very generic or counterfeit. I returned the 1st pair for a replacement of the real clippers and received another pair of the fake clippers. I am disappointed because this is not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Tip

customer_reviews.title: No good!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem very sharp like described and one side of blade seemed uneven, like chipped. I have a golden so her nails are pretty thick. I did like the spring back for these, previous clippers I had did not have that spring and makes it difficult to move thru the nails quickly before pup gets irritated. These ones make that a little easier and if you have a smaller nailed dog I'm sure these would be acceptable. UPDATE:I've only used them once or twice and they aren't able to cut the nail safely and make my pup uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: LOVE AT FIRST SNIP!
customer_reviews.text: I have used various pet nail trimmers over the years, and have hated the process more than my pets. I finally quite stalling and cut my 65lb smooth Collie-mix after watching a 35 second YouTube review. I was astonished at how quickly and smoothly the nails came off. No splintering, and no crushing of the nail. Wow! Because the nails are so long I will have to nip small parts at a time, but it will not be a problem. I am almost looking forward to trimming next week. These trimmers seem sharp enough, but if I have issues with continued use I will update. As for now, I and my Collie are so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Dolls by Dotti

customer_reviews.title: really nice clippers if you don't get the cheap knockoff
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these awhile back, they're great. Much easier to clip my dogs thick black nails. Quick clean cuts. I decided to get an extra pair to keep in another part of the house. The 2nd set I got are clearly cheap knock offs. The packaging was different with incoherent "english". The hardware (hinge, bolts, handle, etc) feels much cheaper. The hinge mechanism has a great deal of play. And the blade thickness is nearly half of the genuine item, see photo. These are getting returned and I will try my luck with another seller.
customer_reviews.author: t.webb

customer_reviews.title: Works well on tough nails
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to find good clippers that handle the extra tough nails of large dogs. I have a 50 lb pit mix, and these worked like a hot knife through butter. I also have a 130 lb american bulldog who has caused the early retirement of a number of other substandard nail clippers. While it wasn't as easy as my "smaller" dog, it was very manageable and not nearly the struggle as Ive had with nail clippers in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nail trimmer for large dogs - my vet recommended this brand and size
customer_reviews.text: We have a 145lb Akita with massive paws and nails to match - thick and tough. This clipper works very well. I had not trimmed our dogs nails before and was paying $20 a shot at my vet to have them do it - only because I was nervous to do it myself fearing I would nick the quick of my dog's nail bed (he has several very dark nails - difficult to see the quick). However, my vet uses this particular clipper so was patient in showing me how to use it effectively. I ordered the size my vet uses, followed his guidance and instructions, and all went well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kitke

customer_reviews.title: These work every well for larger dog nails and fit nice in the hand.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the size of the handles. They fit very well in my hands. I have tried the small handled nail clippers and while some work they were harder on my female boxer. These make it easier with the larger size. It also helps if you are used to clipping your dogs nails already. They have a guide that helps not clip the nail too short and catch the quick (vein), that is very handy and saves having to take her to the emergency room or use the clotting paste and clean the blood off the floor. I highly recommend these if you do your dogs nails.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective for our dog
customer_reviews.text: The large volume of sales and many good reviews prompted me to try this tool. Certainly looked sturdy and my expectations were high. Unfortunately, these clippers did not work well on my 55 pound dog. Granted his nails are fairly big but the tool seemed to squeeze the nail instead of a clean, quick, cut. It also took more force than I expected it would take. I'd say, maybe it's me or my dog, but nail trimming is not exactly a complex event, or should not be.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Lane

customer_reviews.title: They split the nail every time - Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a set of trimmers from Walmart before this purchase and they split both of my dog's nails. I ordered these with the hope to have access to a more decent pair. No.... No... Nope. They split the nail and I couldn't imagine how that feels for them. I wish I knew the brand that I had for 10 years. DO NOT GET RID OF YOUR OLD PAIR if you do not need to. Now I am looking to purchase a 3rd pair because of this and I do not trust my sources. Maybe ask the vet... That is what I may just do. Best of luck to you and your furbabies!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Beard-Haas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Cut Dogs Nails With
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cause I have 3 dogs and two are English Bulldogs and their nails are hard to cut being thick and they can be testy if it takes too long to clip them in one of our EB groups I saw a lady with these and she highly recommended them and man am I so glad we got them super easy to use love the guard keeps you from going to far up the nail and cuts quickly so less time cutting nails, excellent quality highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: T Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through Mastiff nails EASILY!
customer_reviews.text: We raise Neapolitan Mastiffs and Chiesa Mastiffs (150-200 lbs) with tree-trunk legs & railroad spike nails lol - These clippers cut through their HUGE, THICK nails like a hot knife through butter- Comfortable grip, SUPER sharp & well made. ** If the nail guard is "floppy"/loose, a simple adjustment with a screwdriver is all that is needed to tighten- easy peasy! ....(some people obviously are too lazy/ignorant to allow for manufacturing/shipping maladjustment on products... natural selection will take care of them... eventually lol) LOVE these ...A+!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy C

customer_reviews.title: very, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: buy this clipper - great product - great price... at my doorstep under 10bucks - wow.. very sharp - smooth cut - comfort grip -- guard is a must ! , you'll never go back to another style.. gives u proper alignment and the confidence to make quick clean cuts .. my large very difficult dog tolerates these very very well.. large size perfect for my dogs very large nails...highly recommended..
customer_reviews.author: Elmer rice

customer_reviews.title: I love those nail trimmer and would not hesitate to recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Look I have pretty nails trimmed and I can run fast without injuring my paws.!. I love those nail trimmer and would not hesitate to recommend it. I have tried several pairs through the years, I always had dogs, they were or too small in my hand or not strong enough. This is by far my favorite. They are big enough for big dogs and works well with smaller dogs as well. The grip is perfect - it stays really steady in your hands - therefore you do not have to think about the nail trimmer sliding and you can focus on the dog's nails.
customer_reviews.author: Seabreeze

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 German Shepherd and 1 Lab mix dogs, it has always been hard to find a nice pair of nail trimmers that make a nice clean cut without breaking their nails apart when trimming them and these do just that. We have been very happy with our purchase and so have our dogs, a now fast clean cut with the nail trimmers and their done. They are also easy to hold in your hand and don't pinch you when cutting the nail. Will definitely purchase again when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use than the blue handled pair another company sells.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg P.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use--can't move the length guard to both sides
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm a fan. Way better than the crummy ones you could get at the pet section of the grocery store for the same price. My 70lb rescue dog came with super thick, overgrown nails and this cuts through them without much strength. My only complaint thus far is that you can only slide the length guard (the little piece of metal attached by the blades) to one side. When I'm switching position all around trying to get the best angle, I like to just slide the bugger out of my way, but I can't always do that without adjusting the whole clippers because it only slides to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Tasia

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after fighting with CON-air ones. These actually cut my Husky's nails, instead of breaking them off like the Conair ones I bought at Petsmart. They have a guard so you can't cut too much of the nail - but unless the nail is very long, you may end up clipping the quick anyways. Have some flour or cornstarch on hand to stop the bleeding in case that happens! I also have the med-small ones, and they have served me well the past few years. They are still very sharp even after trimming the nails of countless foster dogs!
customer_reviews.author: ChristineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: These worked great! I have a 90 pound chocolate lab with ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked great! I have a 90 pound chocolate lab with huge thick nails. They were desperately needing to be trimmed down and I was really worried that I wasn't going to be able to find some that would work. My pup has some severe anxiety but reluctantly let me trim them. It took all of 3 minutes and she even let me examine all of them once she realized it was quick and painless! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid snippers
customer_reviews.text: I tried this style of snippers from Dollar General for $5. Same shape and design, different steel. Flimsy, flexible, useless. These are really heavy gauge steel, really solid. I tried to bend them on purpose, it's not possible. Line it up, touch the nail with the safety cup, snip. Way easier and faster than vertical guillotine style snippers. I was able to finish my dog's nails front and back in like 2 minutes. Used to take 10 or more to line up the nail safely while holding his paws steady. These are incredibly strong, fast and convenient snippers. Glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Sharp blades
customer_reviews.text: Very good design! We have one of our dogs that still has his "dewclaw". This is impossible to trim with our current clippers because they are not open at the top. Having this one open at the top allowed us to clip it quickly and he didn't even realize it! It often hurt with the other clippers because it was hard to get to. These new clipper solved our problems! And, we realized it really was time to make the switch to new sharper blades!
customer_reviews.author: Sharri

customer_reviews.title: Not safe to use.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like how loud these are and they are hard to hold. Also it cuts off more material than you want. I used the guard as instructed and immediately ran to get the Kwik stop because my poor lab was bleeding everywhere. I don’t recommend these because they are not that sharp and dangerous to use.
customer_reviews.author: OpporTUNAty Sportfishing

customer_reviews.title: Sharper than our vets trimmers!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a set that gets through my senior dogs nails! We’ve had more trouble with our 10 yr old anxiety prone labs nails and I swear we’ve tried everything! We used regular large dog clippers, but they just bent nail. Next was Dremel & Hertzo auto filing, but those got both dogs shaking and running off, so I tried these. While they did cause bleeding (even with guard) it was quick and easy. We did NOT have to spend HOURS grinding them with shaving tool.
customer_reviews.author: CCS86

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are really great! My dog is really difficult when it comes to getting his nails done. He won't let groomers or even the vet do it so we really need quality nail clippers so we can do it quickly and pain free. Our old clippers were dull and you could hear/feel it crunching through the nail instead of slicing. These slice very easily. We're able to clip his nails in minutes without him minding too much. He's a big dog so he has big paws and very thick nails. Super happy with these clippers!
customer_reviews.author: Richard and Haley Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have a small breed dog, I purchased this large nail trimmer for dogs. I have large hands, and this trimmer is very easy to hold and grasp firmly. I especially appreciate that these are very sharp so that I never have to hurt my dog by trying to cut the same nail more than once. They cut cleanly nails cleanly and quickly. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: musicmuse

customer_reviews.title: Safety Guard shouldn't be a selling point...
customer_reviews.text: These nail trimmers work just fine for both the dog and the cat. No crushing of the nails or anything like that. I personally think the safety is a waste of time. Honestly, unless you have a really big dog or their nails are REALLY long, do not use the safety as a guide as you will likely overtrim and hurt your animal. I wish the blade wasn't inset as it would be easier to see when clipping the nails, but I think most clippers are made this way (even outdoor ones). These trimmers work just fine, but definitely don't buy them for the safety guard alone.
customer_reviews.author: cilah12Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: As an ex dog groomer I am super picky about what I use on my dogs. As someone who has had multiple hand surgeries due to CTS and has only 70% use of my dominant hand, size, weight, and strength needed matter a lot to me. Not only are these nail clippers great but they are easy for me to use. Some nail clippers require a bit of strength but these work awesome! I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I have two medium-large dogs who hate having their thick nails trimmed. I figured our old clippers might be getting dull and picked these up as a replacement. I can't believe how good these are for the price! Much more comfortable for the dogs and a lot easier for me to use. Made short work of an unpleasant chore, and I think the dogs will be more amenable to having it done more often.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I owned a same pair of these but recently misplaced it so I had to purchase again. I had the other one for a few years and it never lost its sharpness. While it is durable and easy to use, I have used different nail trimmers for large dogs that worked better. Overall a good pair of nail trimmer, that's why I purchased it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Kim

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great
customer_reviews.text: The product is really nice and does the job pretty effortlessly. It can be a little tricky to figure out at first, I have pinched my hand a few times, and it can be hard to adjust to different angles. I have used this on my dogs and my guinea pigs. Guinea pigs have tiny nails so if you plan to use it for an animal with smaller animals I will say, it is very tough due to how big it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Keller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our basset hound! Should have bought them sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have tried these sooner! We have a basset hound who gets really anxious when getting her nails clipped and her nails were always so rough after being clipped, so I purchased a grinder. The grinder was useless, so I read the reviews and bought these. These clip her nails so much more easily than our clippers from the store. They are easy, clean, smooth, seemingly painless clips that don't really bother our dog much and I feel perfectly comfortable clipping them myself!
customer_reviews.author: klclyn

customer_reviews.title: Clean cutting trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product because we have had one or two manual nail trimmers in the past, purchased at local pet stores, which haven't been very good. They weren't sharp enough and squeezed the dogs' nails, causing pain. This trimmer was quick and easy to use. It made a clean cut and the dogs (two golden retrievers with nails that were getting quite long) didn't seem to mind it much. Will update if something changes in the future but for now, we are quite happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: zsf

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fast quick cut with good control
customer_reviews.text: Works great, fast quick cut with good control. We used to have the guillotine style and they never worked well, often shredding our dogs nails. These cut the nails sharply with no shredding. We use the safety stop and on both of our dogs they haven't had trims for some time so we had a little bleeding but on the nails that were shorter the safety stop was spaced fine. I'll give this 5-stars as any trimmer w/ a safety stop probably would have resulted in the same situation so I fault us for not keeping the nails trimmed not the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the pooch.
customer_reviews.text: I can finally clip the dog's nails. At first I was apprehensive because I didn't want to hurt the dog by cutting her nails too low or close to the quick. This nail trimmer was effective and swift. The trimmer has sharp blades. The nail guide prevents over clipping, and the trimmer handle allows for a secure slip free grip. Pooch was antsy, agitated and resistant initially, but once I got her on her back as if I was going to rub her belly, the task was completed without blood or pain for the pooch. Thank you Safari for making a dog nail trimmer that makes a difficult task easier.
customer_reviews.author: Maxie

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd wasn't mad this time
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research to find nail clippers that opened wide, were strong and sharp enough, I found them here! Went to 3 stores locally trying to find nail clippers for my German Shepherd, who had very thick nails and hates having them clipped. Found nothing. Did some research online and bought these. They were it! Cut her nails on all 4 paws in one sitting, less thank 15 minutes. These things are strong. Will be purchasing a second pair to put up, in case we lose these.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: We are so happy and relieved to have found these!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best clippers I have owned!! They slice right through my pitbull's gnarly nails, no squeezing super hard and struggling to cut. I'm so happy and relieved because nail trimming was awful for both of us before (we had the guillotine like clippers and they were terrible, wouldn't cut and they split her nails).
customer_reviews.author: tmckim

customer_reviews.title: I liked enough that I bought two.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of the safety stop. I have used it on another trimmer and the mechanism was loose and it moved. Truthfully, if you are using the safety stop, you aren't trimming the mails often enough. I really wanted a quality guillotine style but must say, having used these a few times, these are far sharper and superior to the guillotine. Not only did it cut the puppy's nails like a hot knife through butter, it cut the surrounding hairs too. I bought a large and it worked just fine on a 7 week old collie so she will have no problem growing into it. This is made in Taiwan
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  Great value, too.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd nail trimmer I have bought and these are by far the best! I have an 80 pound black golden doodle. I was worried about clipping his nails because his nails are black. These are SUPER easy to use. They did not splinter the nails and they were really easy to take a larger pieces of the nail or very very thin pieces to the nail off. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kmomof 3

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers and super easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have never cut my dogs nails on my own before. I have 2 large dogs with dark/black nails and have always been afraid I would hurt them. I haven’t been able to get them to a groomer recently so I figured for the price I would give it a shot. I used the shield which made me sure I wasn’t taking too much off and it was super easy. Both dogs seem to feel better and it only took about 20 min to do both, the time was because one has sensitive pads and I had to adjust my grip. I would recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, strong clippers
customer_reviews.text: These are great clippers. Ordered a Large, as we have two pit bulls. One dog is 75lbs, one is 58lbs. I lost a pair of our “Rollins pets” clippers when we moved... but they are no longer available. These have proven to be an excellent replacement. Very strong , sharp and well made. Would purchase again. Tip: for our large dog with super thick nails, I take a little off each nail at a time... it puts a lot less stress on the entire nail.
customer_reviews.author: CBoogie

customer_reviews.title: Snip snip!
customer_reviews.text: These are very sharp! I had no idea just how CRAPPY my old ones were until I used these. I have a 60 LB basset hound and it cut through his hard nails like butter. Our dogs hate getting their nails clipped but since we switched to these, they haven't been NEARLY as squirmy as they used to. I think our old clippers were probably too dull and hurting them. I'll definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmers!
customer_reviews.text: Got the large trimmers for my border collie boxer mix. He is about 60 lbs. They worked great! The guard was a good distance from the trimmers to ensure that I only took off small bits each nail and did not hit the quick. I was able to confidently cut his few black nails after consistently doing two passes on all of his white/clear nails. Would definitely recommend! This was my first time trimming dog nails but I have done rabbit and cat before.
customer_reviews.author: bouldershade

customer_reviews.title: Game changer! No longer have to wrestle my dog for 2 hours.
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews. I don't think most of what I've purchased has been notably amazing before. I opened my box with these nail trimmers ten minutes ago and in the time since have successfully trimmed the nails of my 4 dogs all over 50 lbs. My one dog has extremely hard, black nails and they have broken the last 2 nail trimmers I've tried. This trimmer was so pai less for him that it wasn't nearly as difficult as normal to wrestle each paw to get to the nails. GREAT PRODUCT!!!! Also, sharp and strong enough for difficult nails. The guide allows for the perfect trim length. Didn't hit the quick on any of my 4 dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Berko

customer_reviews.title: Works like it was designed!!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter works for a Vet, and she loves this tool. She says this is better than what they have in the office. We have a lot of rescue dogs from a Golden, 2 Boxers 2 Hounds and 2 mini doodles and a few others. But thier nails get long fast so she is always cutting them, tool seems to hold up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: photofpd

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A Durable nail trimmer!!
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through many nail trimmers over the years most of which have either dulled after a few uses or literally have fallen apart. These, however, work great for my dog. It cuts my dog's nail well and does not shred his nails. I have an 80-pound dog and he's usually skittish with nail cutters but has not been with these. The nail trimmer is very durable but because of that be prepared to use more force to squeeze the trimmer completely to get a clean cut for a larger dog. I'd recommend these to a large dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Asi

customer_reviews.title: Quick, painless and well-made -- ALL my dogs, tiny to giant-sized,  get nails trimmed easily.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs NEVER like having their nails cut and they run just as much when they see these in my hand, BUT... the nice thing about these is that I can set the stop, grab a paw and actually snip 3 or 4 nails before they get away. It's because I can snip more or less blindly with these without worrying about over-cutting the nails. I have 9 dogs ranging in size from 12 pounds to 150 pounds and it works well for all. They are sharp, the spring brings the blade back into position quickly and if I work fast, over time, all the nails get trimmed. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S.

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am happy with the product and it does what it's supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: This has made taking care of the nails a non-issue. I initially got a different trimmer that was advertised as a safer alternative. That was safe because it hardly cut anything and had to be replaced and I had to wrestle with the dog for 30 mins. This one is so sharp that I can cut several before the dog expects a treat. It also has a safety guard but if the nail hasn't grown enough, this safety measure will not prevent bleeding. Overall I am happy with the product and it does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer does not cut very well - the blades squeeze and pull on my dog's nails and it's impossible to get a clean cut. I'm confused by all the raving reviews since it's not a very well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product about three weeks ago and have been using it once a week. These are my thoughts... PROS: -Sturdy design -sharp and cuts well -Not as intimidating as the other scissors that are available -little lock is pretty neat -Nice color - i do wish there was more choice CONS: -A bit on the pricier side. I found one at walmart for $5 bucks Bottom line: I would buy another one or two of these if the price was lowered. UPDATE 1/23: These still work great and even though I use them twice a week, they look new!
customer_reviews.author: ~*Princess*~

customer_reviews.title: Size DOES matter!! 100% easier and faster on large dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what a huge difference size would matter when it comes to dog nail clippers. My Weimaraner will now allow me to cut her nails swiftly rather than squeeze with all my strength only to hurt and hack the nail. Size DOES matter!! 100% easier and faster on large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2 Boys

customer_reviews.title: Safari clipper
customer_reviews.text: Safari nail clipper is very easy to use and also last forever. I am a professional dog groomer, I am using it everyday with many many dogs, it’s very safe with bear quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! Super sharp and stay that way!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! They are so sharp they cut perfectly through even the largest of nails! They do not pinch the nails at all so you don't have to worry about breaking the nail while cutting. They are so sharp it makes it easy to just shave off small amounts of nail at a time to keep from hurting your baby! I work in a grooming salon so I use these everyday multiple times a day and they are still cutting just as good as when I first got them. I had my last pair for 2 years and they were still perfectly sharp! I lost them down the drain...so I had to have a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Well, But The Handle Will Pinch You
customer_reviews.text: This clipper is well made and cuts through my standard poodle's nails very cleanly. My only complaint is that the handle area near the clipper end comes to a very hard, sharp corner. And if you're not careful, you will crush the skin of your hand when you snap the clippers closed. Because it's a sudden motion, you don't realize you're in trouble until it's too late. It would have been easy enough to round out those edges, but for some reason they made them very boxy. So overall, it works well, but you really have to watch yourself or you may pinch you hand enough to get a blood blister or even cut into your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Trim early, trim often
customer_reviews.text: These work well and my dog still hates me. To be fair I’ve never had a dog that didn’t try to kick me in the face when it comes to nail trims. Maybe that says more about me than the nail trimmers...either way, the nail guard helps me not over trim anymore, but the trust issues are already there so there’s going back now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I make my teenager clip our lab's nails and she hated doing it cause they are thick and difficult to cut. It was always a struggle with our dog and we could only get one foot done at a time. I think the blade was dull also so it didn't work as well as it should. But after getting these new nail trimmers it's been a world of difference. She's maintaining him more consistently and she's more confident about clipping because she's not worried about hurting him.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and sharp nail trimmers. Make sure to acclimate your dog to them first, use LOTS of treats! These cut very easily so make sure you have a solid grip on their paw before you squeeze. I am very happy with the performance of these clippers!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: I had these and loved them and I had a different pair that I hated. I was cleaning out the doggy grooming bin and threw this pair away by accident! They make a nice clean quick cut. I’m not sure if it’s because of the design or that they are very sharp or maybe both. Regardless, they are great. I ordered myself a replacement and all is good now. 😁
customer_reviews.author: mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Works great, compared to others I've used
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than other nail clippers I've tried, especially on my Bassett Hound, who has very thick nails. These clippers are sturdy and clip cleanly and quickly. When I have some help reassuring him, I can do all of the nails in one sitting. Even when I'm alone, though, I can still do a few nails at a time. That was very difficult before, with other clippers, and I'd be lucky if I could clip even one cleanly without causing him distress.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ford

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT get what I ordered, or what is shown online. I got Chinese knock off GARBAGE!! And it appears to have already been opened and returned!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an old pair of nail clippers for my dogs that was probably 15-20 years old. The mechanism started to catch and my husband wanted to oil them but I ordered a new pair :>. I was surprised at how sharp the new pair was and how much easier it was to clip my dogs'nails! Treat yourself and your dogs to a new pair and forget about oiling the old pair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: These are really sharp.. I upgraded from an off brand. Now I feel terrible I ever used those on my dog and tossed them in the trash! My dogs are pretty easy to do nail trims on, but these make it easier and quicker! I really love the Safari brand, and I also bought a new slicker brush, and grooming scissors. They are high quality for a good price
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Mastiff nail trimmer
customer_reviews.text: To9k my 🐕 to vet to have her nails cit, 😄 tjey charged me $60s, said nope, went on azon and bought this as per reviews. Wasn't disappointed at all. It was 3asy to.trip her nail and it has a safety added to it.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeZILLA

customer_reviews.title: GET THESE
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I can get through ANY nail. They cut so smoothly I do not think it hurts my dogs at all. I recommend these nail clippers to EVERYONE. We have 5 dogs: Catahoula Leopard Dog 35 pounds white nails Great Pyrenees Dog 115 pounds white thick nails Great Pyr/Am Staff mix Dog 75 pounds black nails Great Pyr/Am Staff mix Dog 60 pounds white nails Husky Dog 55 pounds white nails
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Gunkel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Hold an Edge
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair of nail trimmers around this time last year. They worked fine the first 4 or 5 times. Now, I'm back today to purchase another pair of clippers because these are too dull. I didn't purchase these with the intention of having to replace them annually so I'll buy another brand and hope they hold an edge longer than 5 or 6 clipping sessions, For the record, I was using these on my Staffordshire Terrier with rather thick nails.
customer_reviews.author: Mood Swings

customer_reviews.title: Will make my dogs cringe in fear.
customer_reviews.text: My two 50-lb German Sheppard puppies are scaredy-cats! First time I used this, they were willing. Second time- NO WAY! Gonna have to sedate these guys to use it. However, the design of this tool takes a lot of guess-work out of the equation with that built-in guard. Make sure you angle correctly and the dog sits still long enough for an accurate cut. We had to treat them to death last time just so they would sit still. A 2-MAN OPERATION! Also, grab some Styptic Powder for that just-in-case moment. Their nails bleed for a while if cut too deep!
customer_reviews.author: AmznIsMyMall

customer_reviews.title: So great! Sharp and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I read that some reviewers said these weren't sharp. I tested them out as soon as they came in the mail, and I'm 100% satisfied. They're sharp and made trimming such a breeze. The fold-over nail guard didn't get in the way; the clippers were sharp and cut very clean. My dogs hate getting their nails trimmed, but this made it so easy and quick that they barely had time to put up a fight. I'd definitely order these again.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the difficult pup!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace our old ones because of all of the good reviews. Definitely wasn't disappointed!! Our pup HATES his nails clipped, and I'm able to clip a few on my own at each sitting with him. It used to take me and my husband to do it, and I'd be lucky to get one done at a time.
customer_reviews.author: KailaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Industrial-Strength Nail Trimming for BIG Dogs (and Little Ones, Too)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this nail trimmer; I'm always a little skittish when trimming my dogs' nails, but this one's sharp, stays reliably "parked" in your hand, and gets the job done quickly and safely. It has a built-in guard so you can be careful about just how much you cut off. I have 3 dogs whose nails need cutting, from a big White Lab/Great Pyrenees mix with huge, thick nails to two medium sized Yorkie Poos. This trimmer works well for all three and I like the fact it's easy to clearly see how much length you're about to cut off; I haven't overdone it yet. Great design, economical price, and a quality product; highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: They're okay.
customer_reviews.text: No better or worse than other clippers I've owned. To be fair, my dog (Rhodesian/Bloodhound) has monstrous nails, so I guess I shouldn't expect a miracle. I'll just go back to the Dremel, because we haven't found a pair of clippers that have worked for us yet. Poor guy is terrified of having his nails done.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and sturdy. This is amazing for the price. It's a quick way to clip my dogs nails. My dog is 35 pounds and has German shepherd, lab, birdie collie and ridgeback in him... so his paws and nails are medium size and this is amazing !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have always cut our dogs toenails and having big dogs it is not always and easy chore. Always used the guillotine type in the past but never again. This trimmer was not real expensive and works great. Less stress for me and the dogs. Has a safety feature but I find it easier to use without it. If this one becomes dull or is lost, will definitly buy another one.....even thought of buying a second one just so I know I will have it.
customer_reviews.author: Frosti

customer_reviews.title: Bait & switch. Wrong brand sent. Included bonus rust.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong brand and wrong size, see photos. They sent a cheap knockoff that has a very poorly ground cutting bevel with rust and a burr on the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence..
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with these trimmers! They have a very solid feel, are extremely sharp and have remained that way after almost a year of use with 2 dogs (Bulldog mix & a GSD), and are priced fairly compared to the local pet store. I've read a couple reviews where they experienced splintering/rough cuts however I never had that problem. I usually do the nail trimming after bathing them so I'm sure that helps. These are definitely the best I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Best clippers ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best clippers ever! I have a Dalmatian/Golden Retriever mix who HATES getting her nails clipped. She has very thick, long black nails that grow super quickly. With out last pair (generic brand), they would crush her nail and slip from my hand. These are super sharp and cut fast! No crushing, amazing grip that won't slip. I cut all of her front nails (two snips each nail, because they had gotten so long while I found and ordered these) in less than a minute. My Alaskan Malamute/German Shepherd mix got his nails cut for the first time today, and he did wonderful because of how fast these are! I love them and will recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Cuts thick nails
customer_reviews.text: I order a lot of nail trimmers ( supposedly for large dogs), most mediocre, some crack the dogs thick nails. These worked great. I will be happy if they last 2 cuts. 1 slight drawback is a snap noise that makes the pooch jump a little but 5 stars anyway
customer_reviews.author: petunia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, even for my timid rescue
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a rescue and is very timid. I used to take her to the vet each time I needed to have her nails clipped. However, that got old really quick. So I decided to start doing it myself. These clippers are sharp, easy to use, and I like the safety stop so I do not clip too short. Been using them nearly a year now and she gets better every time. I know it is because I am quite confident after using them so many times that I am not going to make a mistake because of the ease of use of these clippers.
customer_reviews.author: JayneDoah

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this nail clipper for years. I only rebought it because the clipper was getting dull after more than 7 years of use. When it gets dull, I have to put more pressure when pressing down on the clipper so I decided to get a new pair but I love this brand and I think it's quality product
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm on Large Labrador
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use on my 85lb Labrador, and could not be happier. I have tried a few different types of trimmers and none of them worked on his thick nails. These worked perfectly and cut through his nails with ease. We will definitely continue to use these, and will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Great size.
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates getting his nails cut. But this is a fast way to do it. I also use a grinder because this does leave sharp edges. My dog is 45LBS. with some good size nails. So unless you do lots of walks. I would also buy a grinder to help smooth out the nails.
customer_reviews.author: Hester FM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, as always.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these nail trimmers after owning the smaller pair and falling in love with them! These have a very sturdy feel, and open and close smoothly without catching or sticking. The blades are very sharp and very strong, you can actually feel them slicing through the nail, as opposed to snapping or crushing as with most other trimmer I have used. I am a professional groomer in a corporate salon, so these trimmers have seen quite a bit of use in the short time I have owned them. This comes as no surprise, as I have yet to be dissatisfied with a Safari product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp and good to use. My dog has never been a fan of getting his nails trimmed, normally requiring two people to get him to stay still when trying. Since I've switched to using these he's been fine with it, which I assume is due to these trimmers ability to quickly snip away the nails rather than smash them off like the lesser trimmers would do.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Neely

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Collie nails
customer_reviews.text: Went through several types/brands before settling on these. The scissors style of these makes them easy to handle. My dog isn't jumpy, but when she does move the scissor style comes away easier than the guillotine style. They are very sharp, cut cleanly through the nail with no ragged edges, and make almost no noise. I don't use the guard that comes on these and if I push it to the side it doesn't get in the way at all. As a reference: I am currently using these on a 5 month old Collie puppy. She's small for her breed (will only be 45lbs full grown) but the large size works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Best I’ve ever used! Smooth cut even with my weak little hands!
customer_reviews.text: Best nail clippers ever!!! My sugar bear has such thick nails that it used to take both hands and all the force within me to clip her nails. They would split and crack with every other clippers I tried. I finally got these today and I gotta say 100% difference. I cut all 20 of her long thick nails with ease and even used my left hand on her hind feet. She was comfortable because is was such a smooth and easy cut evert time! Thank goodness I found these! Now she can walk without pain from her extra long nails! Highly recommend for those of you that have big dogs with extra thick nails.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CLIPPERS!!
customer_reviews.text: These clippers cut SO well!! It’s like slicing through butter. My doggo still hates having her nails clipped...but these are great! I can quickly snip and reduce the heat time and strain on my dog! FYI 55lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodder140

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the best clippers a local farm store had to offer and found them too flimsy to cut my 50lbs. dog's nails. These clippers I bought after because of the Amazon return policy. They provide a clean cut and I'm able to reclip without fear of cracking the nail. The grip sticks to your palm and the depth guide doesn't give so you stay accurate and safe. I would definitely recommend this product to the home groomer and never needed to use the return.
customer_reviews.author: Thissell

customer_reviews.title: Good clippers did the job!
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are sharp and worked well on my little dogs' nails but are just a bit larger than the other, more common type I usually use. Clippers have a guard on them so that you don't cut the nails too short. That's a good feature! Overall, I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Hall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pair of dog nail trimmers
customer_reviews.text: These nail trimmers are great. They're not lightweight but not overwhelming. The perfect size and weight, really. The trimmers fit comfortably in your hand and they feel substantial, so they won't be slipping out of your hand while you try to trim your dog's nails. I love that it has the guard to keep you from cutting to the quick. I feel confident that I won't need to replace this, maybe for the life of my dog. Probably the best nail trimmers I've ever had. Now if I could get my dog to sit still for the trimming. Price is great, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this Trimmer...Large...for my 10 pound Chihuahua. She is an indoor girl, so her nails grow fast and strong. I figured if they were bigger and stronger they would cut easier and it would be faster and smoother for her. I was right! Her nails went quickly and striaght. SO GLAD I don't have to spend the money and time at a Groomer's just to have her nails trimmed any more. I read instructions on line on how to avoid the 'Quick' so we didn't have any problems...little bit at a time is the trick, and don't try and get them too short. She's easy to bathe, and towel dry, so we are 'Good to Go'!
customer_reviews.author: Bay Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fast/Safe/Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st nail trimmer that actually works as described! We used to have to pin our Lab & take it real slow & move positions to get the correct angle. The safety guard gave me the confidence to speed this process up. It took less than 5 minuets (We still pinned him for his safety) He did not cry or flinch!
customer_reviews.author: Berta

customer_reviews.title: perfect for thick nails and it goes through like butter
customer_reviews.text: reliable nail clippers that'll even go through a mastiffs nails! perfect for thick nails and it goes through like butter. had them since may 2016 and used them 5 times a week and multiple times a day and have yet to find something to complain about!
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: I snipped just the ends and was amazed at how well it cut through the claws
customer_reviews.text: I have not used a nail clipper in a very long time. In the past used the kind that snips from the front, so a little apprehensive about using this product. I snipped just the ends and was amazed at how well it cut through the claws! SHARP! Used Furry Fudo to grind down some more and round it off so no nags on rugs. Love the bi-color green, light weight, spring action, quick stop and safety lock. Very happy with Safari!
customer_reviews.author: Ms Mary MacTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a good clipper for constant use
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional pet groomer and do lots of nails day in day out! This is NOT a good clipper for constant use, but would be OK for someone using it on occasion at home on their own pet. The mechanism for opening and closing wore out within a month. This is the second time I have purchased this clipper with the same results
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kramer

customer_reviews.title: This device works great but you have to be very careful not to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my rescued Pit Bull since her previous owners did not care to clip her nails. This device works great but you have to be very careful not to clip into the vain in their toes, if you try too much at one time it will hurt them. We introduced her to the tool before we used it (let her smell it and show her she shouldnt be afraid of it) right now we are able to clip 3 out of 4 paws without her running off. This tool isnt right for every dog but it works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Order - Chinese Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: This is not a Safari product. This is a knockoff. Do not order this item expecting to receive what is advertised. Please look at other one star reviews, this appears to be common for buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Decent clippers
customer_reviews.text: This is fine. Not great, not awful. It does the job, but is not very sharp- even right out of the package. I did order the smaller size for my smaller dog because the large clippers are too big. I like that there is a guard and it is easy to move around, I just wish they were sharper. The weight is good, they are easy to use and my dogs tolerate these better than others, and definitely better than "guillotine" type clippers- those are awful.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: so these are essential) I used them on my own dogs nails this weekend after they were delivered and they cut so nice and clean
customer_reviews.text: My Dog Nail Trimmers were stolen out of my car since they were in my backpack, and I needed to get a new pair quickly before I needed them in class. (I'm in school to be a Vet Tech, so these are essential) I used them on my own dogs nails this weekend after they were delivered and they cut so nice and clean. The grip is Great, with a little cushion feeling. So much better than the trimmers issued by my school which are the orange handled ones sold on Amazon as well. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Britnye Girton

customer_reviews.title: TOSS YOUR CURRENT TRIMMER NOW.
customer_reviews.text: We had a trimmer for our pup that would fray her nails. I had seen this recommended somewhere, can't remember now, but WOW, it is great. It is sharp so it cuts true and fast. I am impressed because it doesn't fray the nail making nail trimming all the more enjoyable for everyone. Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hostetter

product_meta.title: Safari Professional Large Nail Trimmer For Dogs
product_meta.description: Safari Professional Large Nail Trimmer For Dogs
feature_bullets: Stainless steel cutters for long-lasting sharp edges
Regular trimming should be a part of your grooming routine
Best suited for medium to large breeds
For best results, cut dog's nails immediately after bathing
To make the quick of the dog's nail visible, apply baby oil
If pet's nails are very long, cut off a small amount and wait a week before cutting again
Best suited for medium to large breeds
For best results, cut dog's nails immediately after bathing
To make the quick of the dog's nail visible, apply baby oil
If pet's nails are very long, cut off a small amount and wait a week before cutting again
